snippet: As chemical accidents continued in West Virginia, so did calls for increased oversight, but those recommendations went unheeded by lawmakers, federal regulators said.
abstract: Federal regulators say that as chemical accidents continued in West Virginia, so did calls for increased oversight, but those recommendations went unheeded by state and local lawmakers; latest massive spill into West Virginia’s Elk River is region’s third major chemical accident in five years.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and CORAL DAVENPORT
byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from Charleston, and Coral Davenport from Washington. Daniel Heyman contributed reporting from Charleston, and Jack Begg from New York.

lead_paragraph: As chemical accidents continued in West Virginia, so did calls for increased oversight, but those recommendations went unheeded by lawmakers, federal regulators said.

headline.main: Calls for Oversight in West Virginia Went Unheeded
headline.print_headline: Calls for Oversight in West Virginia Went Unheeded

keywords.value: Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigation Board
keywords.name: organizations
